metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0430 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In skb_headlen of /include/linux/skbuff.h, there is a possible out ofbounds read due to memory corruption. This could lead to local escalationof privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-153881554

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19

linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-45.48~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1032.34~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.28~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.15').
